0: ADOR, Spain, July 16 (UPI) -- A Spanish mayor has become the first in the country to issue a proclamation creating an official afternoon nap time for the entire city. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Mayor Joan Faus Vitoria of Ador in Valencia declared 2 to 5 p.m. as the official time for the city's residents to take their afternoon siestas. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The edict asks residents to keep quiet during the siesta hours and the mayor recommended children be kept inside to prevent noise from traveling into open windows. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The mayor said the nap time was chosen due to the high afternoon heat making 2 to 5 p.m. the ideal time to take a break from working in fields. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Vitoria said there will be no penalties for violations, and the edict should be treated as "merely a suggestion" rather than an "obligation." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A study published in the Endocrine Society's Journal of Clinical Endocrinology & Metabolism in February espoused the health benefits of an afternoon siesta.
